tool.name: Visualize Markers with MuData

configfiles.configfile:
import scanpy as sc import muon as mu mdata = mu.read_h5mu('$rna_atac_input') mdata['$first_mod'].obs['$groupby'] = mdata.obs['$celltype'] mdata['$second_mod'].obs['$groupby'] = mdata.obs['$celltype']
#set $marker_genes = ([x.strip() for x in str($marker_genes).split(',')]) marker_genes = $marker_genes sc.pl.dotplot(mdata['rna'], marker_genes, '$groupby', save="rna_marker_genes.png")
#set $marker_peaks = ([x.strip() for x in str($marker_peaks).split(',')]) marker_peaks = $marker_peaks sc.pl.dotplot(mdata['atac'], marker_peaks, '$groupby', save="atac_marker_peaks.png") mdata.write("rna_atac_marker_genes_peaks.h5mu")

param.name: first_mod
param.label: Name of the RNA modality
param.help: as defined in your MuData file in order to define its marker genes

param.name: second_mod
param.label: Name of the ATAC modality
param.help: as defined in your MuData file in order to define its marker peaks

param.name: groupby
param.label: The key of the observation grouping to consider.
param.help: as defined in your MuData file, also used as groupby in scanpy.pl.dotplot()

param.name: celltype
param.label: The key under which marker genes/peaks are stored in .obs

param.name: marker_genes
param.label: Marker genes
param.help: marker genes to visualize, should be comma-separated
param.value: IL7R, TRAC, GATA3, LEF1, FHIT, RORA, ITGB1, CD8A, CD8B, CD248, CCL5, KLRB1, SLC4A10, IL32, GNLY, NKG7, CD79A, MS4A1, IGHD, IGHM, IL4R, TNFRSF13C, KLF4, LYZ, S100A8, ITGAM, CD14, DPYD, ITGAM, FCGR3A, MS4A7, CST3, CLEC10A, IRF8, TCF4

param.name: marker_peaks
param.label: Marker peaks
param.help: marker peaks to visualize, should be comma-separated

data.name: rna_atac_marker_genes_peaks
data.label: RNA ATAC with Marker Genes and Peaks

tool.help:
**What it does** This tool takes a multimodal data matrix then visualises marker genes across cell types for the RNA modality and visualises marker peaks across celltypes for the ATAC modality.
It returns a dotplot as a png for each modality and the multimodal data matrix after processing.
